key_points: The MV Ever Given, a 'megaship', ran aground in the Suez Canal, blocking traffic.
Evergreen Marine Corp leased the vessel and refuses to pay if it remains stuck.
Efforts to free the ship accelerated, with some traffic expected to resume today.
Ahmed Mekawy of GAC Group reported the ship was partially moved alongside the bank.
The 193km-long Suez Canal is crucial for global trade, affecting tankers and cargo ships.
About 12% of global trade passes through the canal, including oil and liquefied natural gas.
Evergreen leased the Ever Given to add cargo capacity to its East Asia to Europe operations.
The incident was reportedly caused by poor visibility due to a dust storm and strong winds.
Dozens of ships were left gridlocked, attempting to transit between the Red Sea and the Mediterranean.
Evergreen may seek compensation depending on the investigation's findings on the incident's cause.
spokespersons: Ahmed Mekawy (Deputy Manager, Suez Canal, GAC Group)
